info.title: Watching with the stars

abstract.para: After his sweeping victory in Wijk aan Zee, Magnus Carlsen felt he had deserved a break

info.teaser: Magnus Carlsen: Watching with the stars

article.para:
After his sweeping victory in Wijk aan Zee, Magnus Carlsen felt he had deserved a break and of course no one was going to argue with that. Eager to divert his mind, he travelled to the United States. The first days were still filled with business, including an event in Las Vegas with his new American sponsor Parallels (‘a worldwide leader in hosting and cloud service enablement and desktop virtualization’) but then it was time for some fun. Together with a friend he went to see a number of basketball matches in Boston, Philadelphia and New York. In Madison Square Garden he saw the New York Knicks take on the LA Clippers. It’s not easy to get good tickets for such matches, but if you’re well connected you may even get ringside tickets! And there he was, in second row, seated behind Hollywood celebrities Tom Hanks, Christopher McDonald, Olivia Wilde, Jason Sudeikis, Ben Stiller and Christine Taylor. While they seem to feel comfortable with the attention of the photographers, the Norwegian looks less thrilled by the attention of the paparazzi.
Seated behind Tom Hanks and his buddies, Magnus Carlsen watches the New York Knicks vs. the LA Clippers in Madison Square Garden.
